definition:
1. A mender of brass kettles, pans, and other metal ware. "Tailors and tinkers." Piers Plowman. 2. One skilled in a variety of small mechanical work. 3. (Ordnance)  A small mortar on the end of a staff. 4. (Zoöl.) (a) A young mackerel about two years old. (b) The chub mackerel. (c) The silversides. (d) A skate. [Prov. Eng.] 5. (Zoöl.)  The razor-billed auk.

To mend or solder, as metal wares; hence, more generally, to mend.

To busy one's self in mending old kettles, pans, etc.; to play the tinker; to be occupied with small mechanical works.
